pinyin: Nuo4 bei4 er3 Wu4 li3 xue2 Jiang3

definition: texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: Congratulations to Professor Kao on your Nobel Prize in Physics.
sentences.chinese: 祝賀高教授獲得諾貝爾物理學獎。

sentences.english: So, let's give him his credit, Nobel in physics.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們向他崇高的敬意，諾貝爾物理學獎。

sentences.english: He was awarded the Nobel Prize for physics.
sentences.chinese: 他被授予諾貝爾物理學獎。

sentences.english: Einstein won the Nobel Prize for physics in 1921.
sentences.chinese: 1921年愛因斯坦曾榮獲諾貝爾物理學獎金。

sentences.english: Daniel C. Tsui is the 1998 Nobel laureate in Physics.
sentences.chinese: 華裔科學家崔琦是1998年諾貝爾物理學獎獲得者。

sentences.english: Prof. Laughlin is the co-recipient of the 1998 Nobel Prize for physics.
sentences.chinese: 勞克林曾經獲得過1998年的諾貝爾物理學獎。

definition: Chen-Ning Franklin Yang (1922-), theoretical physicist, co-developer of Yang-Mills gauge theory, 1957 Nobel laureate

pinyin: Nuo4 bei4 er3 He2 ping2 jiang3

definition: Grammy Award (US prize for music recording)/also written 格萊美獎|格莱美奖

pinyin: Pu3 lin2 si1 dun4 Da4 xue2

definition: Berkeley (name)/George Berkeley (1685-1753), Bishop of Cloyne, famous British philosopher/Berkeley, university city in the San Francisco bay area, California

pinyin: Lun2 dun1 Da4 xue2 Xue2 yuan4
